Sun.title: See Mars shine close to the waxing crescent moon after sunset on July 28
Sun.description: Mars will be less than four degrees from the crescent moon around sunset on July 28.
Sun.author: Anthony Wood

Sun.title: SpaceX launch from California marks 2nd Starlink mission in 24 hours
Sun.description: Liftoff occurred at 12:31 a.m. EDT on Sunday (July 27).
Sun.author: Robert Z. Pearlman

Sun.title: See a razor-thin moon shine close to Regulus in the evening sky tonight
Sun.description: The bright star Regulus will appear close to the waxing crescent moon at sunset on July 26
Sun.author: Anthony Wood

Mercury.title: February new moon 2025: The young moon occults Mercury and passes by Venus
Mercury.description: On Feb. 28, the one-day-old moon will pass in front of Mercury for observers in Australia and the south Pacific, and on March 1 the moon will make a close pass to Venus.
Mercury.author: Jesse Emspak

Mercury.title: See Mercury at its best in the night sky over the next 2 weeks
Mercury.description: Despite its reputation, Mercury is not really that difficult to spot. But March 2025
Mercury.author: Joe Rao

Mercury.title: Mercury looks stunning in images from BepiColombo spacecraft's 6th and final flyby
Mercury.description: "BepiColombo's main mission phase may only start two years from now, but all six of its flybys of Mercury have given us invaluable new information about the little-explored planet."
Mercury.author: Robert Lea

Venus.title: See Venus, the moon and fiery star Aldebaran form a dawn triangle this weekend
Venus.description: Rise and shine! Venus, Aldebaran and the moon team up for a dazzling dawn display.
Venus.author: Joe Rao

Venus.title: Venus is at its farthest from the sun on June 1: Here's how to see the bright 'morning star' this weekend
Venus.description: Venus will rise in the eastern sky in the pre-dawn hours of June 1 alongside Saturn and Neptune.
Venus.author: Anthony Wood

Venus.title: Venus, Saturn and the moon dazzle at dawn in 'romantic' photo from Chew Valley Lake (photo)
Venus.description: It was a race against the rising sun as astrophotographer Josh Dury captured a fleeting cosmic moment before dawn’s light washed the scene away.
Venus.author: Daisy Dobrijevic

Earth.title: Go behind the gory scenes of Hulu's 'Alien: Earth' with gruesome aliens and crawling eyeballs (video)
Earth.description: "When aliens come to our planet we realize they're really the thing of nightmares, which we're going to give people."
Earth.author: Jeff Spry

Earth.title: How can the James Webb Space Telescope see so far?
Earth.description: Webb has been orbiting more than a million miles from Earth, capturing breathtaking images of deep space. But how does it actually work?
Earth.author: Adi Foord

Earth.title: European Vega C rocket launches CO2-mapping satellite, 4 Earth-observation spacecraft to orbit
Earth.description: Liftoff occurred at 10:03 p.m. ET tonight (July 25).
Earth.author: Mike Wall

Mars.title: See Mars shine close to the waxing crescent moon after sunset on July 28
Mars.description: Mars will be less than four degrees from the crescent moon around sunset on July 28.
Mars.author: Anthony Wood

Mars.title: Wild new 'Skyfall' Mars mission would drop 6 scout helicopters onto the Red Planet from the air (video)
Mars.description: "With six helicopters, Skyfall offers a low-cost solution that multiplies the range we would cover, the data we would collect, and the scientific research we would conduct."
Mars.author: Leonard David

Mars.title: Europe tests largest-ever Mars parachute in the stratosphere above the Arctic (video)
Mars.description: "We are happy to confirm that we have a parachute design that can work on Mars — an ambitious system with the largest parachute ever to be flown outside Earth"
Mars.author: Tereza Pultarova

Jupiter.title: Don't miss the crescent moon cozy up to Jupiter early on July 23
Jupiter.description: The thin crescent moon and Jupiter will be visible to the naked eye for early risers on July 23.
Jupiter.author: Anthony Wood

Jupiter.title: 'Chaos' reigns beneath the ice of Jupiter moon Europa, James Webb Space Telescope reveals
Jupiter.description: "The chemistry in this location is really strange and exciting."
Jupiter.author: Victoria Corless

Jupiter.title: A doomed exoplanet is caught in a 'death spiral' around its star. Can it survive?
Jupiter.description: "This is an ultra-hot Jupiter, and orbits much closer to its star than any other hot Jupiter ever discovered."
Jupiter.author: Robert Lea

Saturn.title: New moon of July 2025 sees Saturn swim with the fishes tonight
Saturn.description: Saturn will be quite distinct in the Pisces constellation.
Saturn.author: Jesse Emspak

Saturn.title: A vast shadow will sweep over Saturn's cloud tops early on July 18: Here's how to see it
Saturn.description: Titan shadow transit seasons occurs just once every 15 years.
Saturn.author: Anthony Wood

Saturn.title: Don't miss the third quarter moon shine near Saturn in the eastern sky tonight
Saturn.description: The left-hand side of the moon will appear lit by direct sunlight, with the right bathed in shadow.
Saturn.author: Anthony Wood

Uranus.title: Scientists find Uranus is surprisingly warm, heating up the case for a new planetary mission
Uranus.description: "I think it strengthens the case for a mission to Uranus."
Uranus.author: Brett Tingley

Uranus.title: Dramatic changes on Uranus, Neptune, Saturn and Jupiter revealed in 10 years of Hubble Telescope images (video)
Uranus.description: The space agency has learned a lot over 10 years observing the weather of our solar system's outer planets.
Uranus.author: Josh Dinner

Uranus.title: 'There are lots of mysteries in our backyard': Revised solar system chemistry explains long-standing puzzles
Uranus.description: "We have been calling Uranus an ice giant, but we don't really know its nature."
Uranus.author: Sharmila Kuthunur

Neptune.title: Astronomers discover strange solar system body dancing in sync with Neptune: 'Like finding a hidden rhythm in a song'
Neptune.description: "This is a big step in understanding the outer solar system."
Neptune.author: Robert Lea

Neptune.title: Don't miss the moon pass close to Saturn and Neptune tonight
Neptune.description: The moon, Saturn and Neptune will rise a little before midnight for those in the U.S.
Neptune.author: Anthony Wood

Neptune.title: Venus is at its farthest from the sun on June 1: Here's how to see the bright 'morning star' this weekend
Neptune.description: Venus will rise in the eastern sky in the pre-dawn hours of June 1 alongside Saturn and Neptune.
Neptune.author: Anthony Wood
